title: Question 12
prompt: Would Zest Stop be a good market for a local organic farm that supplies “seconds”?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

The guide “Selling Directly to Restaurants and Retailers” published by the University of California Sustainable Agriculture Research and Education Program states:
“Find out if they use ‘seconds’—that is produce that is not the top quality in terms of appearance, but which is good nevertheless. They might use vegetables in soups for example, or in a number of dishes where the appearance of the produce is not a factor. This can be very important in supply.”
feedback:
Zest Stop is primarily a smoothie restaurant, and smoothies are juice drinks made from blended fruits and vegetables. As in soup, the appearance of fruit or vegetables in a smoothie would not matter. “Seconds” would be a good source of supply for Zest Stop.


“Find out if they use ‘seconds’—that is produce that is not the top quality in terms of appearance, but which is good nevertheless. They might use vegetables in soups for example, or in a number of dishes where the appearance of the produce is not a factor. This can be very important in supply.”
